item.title: Tree Traversal
item.description: This post contains code snippets for recursive/iterative versions of breadth/depth-first search. Breadth-First Search Level Order Traversal import collections def recursive_level_order(queue, res): if not queue: return node = queue.popleft() res.append(node.val) # process node if node.left: queue.append(node.left) if node.right: queue.append(node.right) return recursive_level_order(queue, res) def iterative_level_order(root): queue = collections.deque([root]) res = [] while queue: node = queue.popleft() res.append(node.val) # process node if node.left: queue.append(node.left) if node.right: queue.append(node.right) return res Depth-First Search Inorder Traversal def recursive_inorder(root, res): if root: recursive_inorder(root.

item.title: First Post

item.title: About

He is constantly looking for ways to improve his programming skills and believes having a solid understanding of fundamentals is important to writing good software.
